text:
Your theme will point to the brand kit via theme settings, but you can still overwrite those colors individually depending on how you configure the theme settings.

Once you're done with dev, It's sort of a moot point because once someone buys your theme it will refer to their brand kit and not yours.

Also curious how others are handling this
But as per marketplace guidelines for theme , the global colors should inherited from brand settings right?
Yes, they should, but that doesn't mean you can't use different colors on your demo site or thumbnails. The code still points to the brand kit, but you should give them the ability to override that

For the demo, there is nothing that says you can not override the colors of the branding. The demo is for you to put forward what the theme looks like. As <@U03AKL6Q1B2> mentions, the branding colors will ultimately change based on the portal of the user and their brand kit.
